src:
Kostić udavio šampiona u Majni, “Bikovi“ brojali do osam
02 Nov 2019, 17:34 by Darko
Ovogodišnje prvenstvo u nemačkoj Bundesligi postaje sve zanimljivije.
Aktuelni šampion, Bajern iz Minhena, doživeo je ubedljiv poraz u Frankfurtu, gde ga je domaći Ajntraht pobedio sa 5:1. Treba reći da su Bavarci od 9. minuta igrali bez isključenog Boatenga, ali to ih ne opravdava za ovakav poraz. Goste je načeo Filip Kostić, koji je u 25. minutu savladao Nojera, da bi nešto kasnije Đibril Sou, na asistenciju Kostića, duplirao prednost. Da ni ovaj meč ne protekne bez gola Roberta Levandovskog, Poljak se potrudio u 37. minutu, ali bila je to, ispostavilo se, slabašna nada gostiju. U drugom poluvremenu još tri lopte su završile iza leđa Nojera, a kod četvrtog gola, koji je postigao Hinteregr, asistent je ponovo bio odlični Filip Kostić. U protokolu nije bilo Dejana Joveljića, a Mijat Gaćinović je u igru ušao u 70. minutu.
Lajpcig je u sredu dao šest golova Volfsburgu u Kupu Nemačke, a danas je još gore prošao Majnc. “Bikovi“ su osam puta tresli mrežu gostiju, a trostruki strelac bio je Timo Verner. Menhengladbahu se ne prepušta prvo mesto, pa su “ždrepci“ danas slavili na teškom gostovanju u Leverkuzenu golovima Venda i Tirama. Kevin Folanad je bio strelac za “farmacute“.
“Milioneri“ su bili ubedljivi protiv Volfsburga, a sve golove postigli su u drugih 45 minuta. Dortmund je poveo golom Torgana Azara, Gerero je povisio na 2:0, da bi konačan rezultat postavio Mario Gece iz penala. Nils Petersen je sa dva gola, drugi u sudijskoj nadoknadi, omogućio svom Frajburgu da donese bod iz Bremena i ostane u vrhu tabele.
Leverkuzen – Menhengladbah 1:2(1:2)Foland 25′ – Vend 18′, Tiram 42′
Dortmund – Volfsburg 3:0(0:0)Azar 52′, Gerero 58′, Gece 88′(p)
Ajntraht – Bajern 5:1(2:1)Kostić 25′, Sou 33′, Abraham 49′, Hintereger 61′, Pasjensija 85′ – Levandovski 37′
RB Lajpcig – Majnc 8:0(5:0)Sabicer 5′, Verner 30’48’,87′, Nkunku 35′, Halstenberg 39′, Poulsen 44′, Mukiele 50′
Verder – Frajburg 2:2(1:1)Rašica 9′, Gebre Selasije 59′ – Petersen 29′,90+3′

POVEZANE OBJAVE
text:
Kostic drowned champion in Main, "Bulls" counted to eight
02 Nov 2019, 16:34 by Darko
This year's German Bundesliga Championship is getting more interesting.
The current champion, Bayern Munich, suffered a convincing defeat in Frankfurt, where he was beaten 5-1 by Eintracht. It should be said that the Bavarians played without Boateng from the 9th minute, but that does not justify them for such defeat. The guests were led by Filip Kostic, who overcame Noyer in the 25th minute, and later, Gibril Soo, with Kostic's assistance, doubled the advantage. That this match would not have gone without Robert Levandovsky's goal, the Pole tried in the 37th minute, but it was, it turned out, poor hope of the guests. In the second half, three more balls ended behind Noyer's back, and in the fourth goal scored by Hinteregr, the assistant again was excellent Filip Kostic. There were no Dejan Joveljic in the protocol, and Mijat Gacinovic entered the game in the 70th minute.
Leipzig gave up six goals to Wolfsburg in the German Cup on Wednesday, and Mainz went even worse today. The Bulls shook the visitors' net eight times, with Timo Warner as the triple scorer. Mönchengladbach is not relegated to first place, so the "stallions" today celebrated their difficult visit to Leverkusen with the goals of Wend and Tiram. Kevin Folanad was the shooter for "pharmacists."
The Millionaires were convincing against Wolfsburg, scoring all their goals in the other 45 minutes. Dortmund led Torgan Azar with a goal, Gerero increased to 2-0 to put Mario Gece in the penalty spot. With two goals, the second in the referee's back, Nils Petersen allowed his Freiburg to score from Bremen and stay in the top spot.
Leverkusen - Mönchengladbach 1: 2 (1: 2) Foland 25 ′ - Wend 18 ′, Tiram 42 ′
Dortmund - Wolfsburg 3: 0 (0: 0) Azar 52 ′, Gerero 58 ′, Gece 88 ′ (p)
Eintracht - Bayern 5: 1 (2: 1) Kostic 25 ′, Sou 33 ′, Abraham 49 ′, Hintereger 61 ′, Pasiencia 85 ′ - Levandovski 37 ′
RB Leipzig - Mainz 8: 0 (5-0) Sabicer 5 ′, Werner 30′48 ′, 87 ′, Nkunku 35 ′, Halstenberg 39 ′, Poulsen 44 ′, Mukiele 50 ′
Werder - Freiburg 2: 2 (1: 1) Rasica 9 ′, Gebre Selassie 59 ′ - Petersen 29 ′, 90 + 3 ′
